meanings.definition: To lower in rank or position.
meanings.sent1: When a player breaks the rules, the coach demotes them to the bench.
meanings.sent2: The manager decided to demote the employee to a lower position.
meanings.sent3: The demotion of the cat from the top of the tree to the ground was quite a sight.
meanings.sent4: The demotion of the sun from its high noon position to the horizon signaled the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: The demotion of the king from his throne to a commoner's status shocked the kingdom.

meanings.definition: To reduce in importance or value.
meanings.sent1: Eating healthy food demotes the risk of getting sick.
meanings.sent2: The bad weather demotes the value of outdoor activities.
meanings.sent3: The demotion of the cookie from a treat to a crumb was disappointing.
meanings.sent4: The demotion of the painting from a masterpiece to a mere sketch was disheartening.
meanings.sent5: The demotion of the diamond from a precious gem to a common stone was unexpected.
